review: Reviews might be more objective if the reviewer was not compelled to fill this field in.  Even filling the field in is not enough, a minimum number of words is required.  Not only that, Amazon sends you an email that looks like the review form that actually is a click-through to the web site.  You cannot rate a purchase using the email as it is made to appear.  Because of the unsolicited email and the hassle Amazon creates in the process forcing a customer to go though all of this to do a review, I always deduct at least two stars.  I am happy to spend money and to give a rating.  Whether or not I provide a minimum length dissertation on the topic should be at my option.

review: I purchased my first Apple TV on Christmas 2012.  It was fantastic.  I plugged it in, entered my account, made sure iTunes was running on my PC and voila! it worked flawlessly.My kids and I watched movies over the entire Christmas vacation.  It was great.  So much so, I purchased a second Apple TV for my bedroom.  Awesome!Then about 4 months ago, Apple updated my box and since then it won't connect to my iTunes account on my PC.  The only thing they are good for is watching ONLY movies I have purchased through iTunes.  All of my home videos of my kids playing and opening presents are no longer available.I did some checking and found that there are many other people encountering the same thing.  When I contacted Apple about my problem, they had me run through a battery of registry updates, network protocol changes, and constant rebooting and restarting and restoring.  Nothing works.So, I am now at a loss.  I really want to love this thing, but it has failed me miserably.  I only hope yours works.  Because, when they work, they are fantastic.
author: T. Person
